newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Irish govt slips further behind in new poll.
newsitem.headline: Irish govt slips further behind in new poll.

text.p: Ireland's "Rainbow-coalition" government, which is widely expected to call an election shortly, has slipped further behind the centre-right Fianna Fail and Progressive Democrats opposition, according to a new Irish Times MRBI opinion poll.

The poll shows Prime Minister John Bruton's Fine Gael party would now win 26 percent of the vote, down four percentage points from the last survey. Its Labour party ally would gain 12 percent, up one point, and the Democratic Left an unchanged two percent.
But the survey shows Fianna Fail, led by Bertie Ahern, was holding a steady 43 percent of the vote and the Progressive Democrats eight percent, also unchanged.
The government has been expected to call an election in May because it has been profiting from a booming economy and announced a give-away tax budget in January.
